contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protein family | Symbol = Pardaxin | Name = Pardaxin | image = PDB 1xc0 EBI.jpg | width = | caption = twenty lowest energy structures of pa4 by solution nmr | Pfam = PF07425 | Pfam_clan = | InterPro = IPR009990 | SMART = | PROSITE = | MEROPS = | SCOP = | TCDB = | OPM family = 235 | OPM protein = 1xc0 | CAZy = | CDD = }} '''Pardaxin''' is a [[peptide]] produced by [[Pardachirus marmoratus|the Red Sea sole]] that is used as a [[shark]] repellent.<ref name="pmid3996550">{{cite journal | author = Primor N | title = Pharyngeal cavity and the gills are the target organ for the repellent action of pardaxin in shark | journal = Experientia | volume = 41 | issue = 5 | pages = 693–5 | year = 1985 | month = May | pmid = 3996550 | doi = | url = }}</ref> It causes [[lysis|lyse]] of [[mammalia]]n and bacterial cells, similar to [[melittin]].<ref name="pmid8620888">{{cite journal | author = Oren Z, Shai Y | title = A class of highly potent antibacterial peptides derived from pardaxin, a pore-forming peptide isolated from Moses sole fish Pardachirus marmoratus | journal = Eur. J. Biochem. | volume = 237 | issue = 1 | pages = 303–10 | year = 1996 | month = April | pmid = 8620888 | doi = | url = }}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{InterPro content|IPR009990}} [[Category:Protein families]] [[Category:Antimicrobial peptides]] {{biochem-stub}}
